name: What are Actions on Google
description: Luke Davis and guest Jessica Dene Early-Cha introduce the concept of Actions on Google, and talk about common terminology.

name: Smart Home Integrations on Google Assistant
description: Jessica Dene Early-Cha and guest Dan Myers go over how to get onboarded to Google Assistant for their smart devices and how voice commands work.

name: Pathway to creating your own Action
description: Jessica Dene Earley-Cha and guest Brad Abrams talk about content, App Actions, and experiences.

name: Creating personality for your Actions
description: In this episode of Assistant on Air, host Jessica Dene Early Cha and guest Wally Brill discuss why it's important to design with persona and how to bring it to life.

name: Intro to the Google Assistant: Build Your First Action (Google I/O'19)
description: This intro session will cover the fundamentals of the Google Assistant and what you can build for the assistive future.

name: Reach the Next Billion Users with Your Actions for the Google Assistant (Google I/O'19)
description: Come learn how users in emerging markets are interacting with the Google Assistant, what they expect from your Actions, and what opportunities you have to grow your services with them.

name: Smart Home 101: How to Develop for the Connected Home (Google I/O'19)
description: This session covers updates on the latest tools and capabilities of our smart home API, along with how developers and device makers alike can benefit from deeper integrations with the Google Assistant ecosystem.

name: Create App-like Experiences on Google Search and the Google Assistant (Google I/O'19)
description: Learn how to create interactive, app-like experiences that engage users right on the Google Search results page and the Google Assistant.

name: Extend Your Android App to the Google Assistant (Google I/O'19)
description: This session is about App Actions and Slices to learn how to let your app users quickly get things done through the Google Assistant.

name: 10 Best Practices for High Quality Actions (Google I/O'19)
description: Learn how to reduce development errors, enhance discovery of your Action, grow your user base, and avoid mistakes along the way when building quality and engaging Actions.

name: Local Technologies for the Smart Home (Google I/O'19)
description: This talk will dive deep into a new SDK that enables developers to locally communicate with and control their smart devices, along with providing a preview of what’s to come.

name: Tools for Building Better Smart Home Actions (Google I/O'19)
description: This session will discuss tools to help developers build smart home Actions that make users’ lives easier.

name: Enhance Your Search and Assistant Presence with Structured Data (Google I/O'19)
description: Learn how to surface your engaging content on Google Search and the Google Assistant.

name: Build Interactive Games for the Google Assistant (Google I/O'19)
description: Learn how to design and develop immersive gaming experiences for the Google Assistant.

name: Voice and Visual: How to Build Actions for Smart Displays and More Devices (Google I/O'19)
description: In this talk, we’ll walk you through design and developer considerations for building multimodal experiences across Google Assistant-enabled devices.

name: How We Built the Google Assistant Sandbox Demos (And How You Can Too) (Google I/O'19)
Data and Insights to Build for the Digital Assistant Era (Google I/O'19)
Designing Quality Conversations for the Google Assistant (Google I/O'19)
description: A conversation designer and a developer will walk you through setting user expectations, handling unexpected user responses, and making improvements with user insights.
